website_summaries.verdict: A well-made, accurate rangefinder for bowhunting or archery.
pros: Owners rave about the accuracy of this rangefinder that is designed especially for bowhunters
Horizontal distance technology makes it easy to spot your target
cons: Somewhat expensive, and for the price you'd expect the low-light performance to be better

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best one out there
customer_reviews.text: I'm familiar with Nikon VR (Vibration Reduction) from my photography, and so I already knew how useful it would be with a sight rangefinder. Indispensable. I can't even imaging using a rangefinder without VR. Clarity is stunning as you would expect from Nikon. Diopter adjustment for you eye(s) works smoothly and holds your setting. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mercer

customer_reviews.title: The image stability is a must have
customer_reviews.text: The image stability is awesome. Makes pinpointing target through cove a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Features and price
customer_reviews.text: Great adjustable field of view magnification and angle finding compensation.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder!
customer_reviews.text: It was time to upgrade to something with inclination/declination correction. This one floated to the top in my research. So for so good. Will give it the real test in about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jenkerson

customer_reviews.title: Great range finder
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this unit and glad to have purchased the VR version.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: nikon range finder
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and the clarity of the picture is great. Very accurate
customer_reviews.author: Ralph koopmann

customer_reviews.title: Great putchase
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! No issues with this and it works amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER L DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected and arrived in a short time
customer_reviews.author: David Gattis

customer_reviews.title: Is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Easy to use and very clear to look through.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Belletire

customer_reviews.title: Much brighter and clearer in daytime than my old Nikon ...
customer_reviews.text: Much brighter and clearer in daytime than my old Nikon, but for the price, not really any improvement in low light situations
customer_reviews.author: njelkman

product_meta.title: Nikon Arrow ID 7000 VR Bowhunting Laser Rangefinder, Green - 16211
product_meta.description:
The calling card of a successful bowhunter is confidence. This season, become unshakable with the help of Nikon's ARROW ID 7000 VR laser rangefinder. Separating it from all others is Nikon's groundbreaking optical VR (Vibration Reduction) system, engineered to reduce vibrations of the image in the viewfinder caused by hand movements while simultaneously aligning the viewed image with the activated laser beam. The result is a rock-solid view of your target together with faster, more precise ranging.

Optical VR (Vibration Reduction) Technology
At the heart of the new ARROW ID 7000 is Nikon's optical VR (Vibration Reduction) system, designed to reduce vibrations of the image in the viewfinder caused by hand movements (by approx. 80%) and simultaneously align the viewed image with the activated laser beam for faster, more precise ranging. The effect of Vibration Reduction: vibrations of the image in the viewfinder caused by hand movement are reduced by approx. 80% (1/5 or less than without VR function based on Nikon's measurement standards.)

Tru-Target Technology
Choose between two different ranging modes depending on the situation. First target priority mode allows you to range an object as small as a fence post while distant target priority mode displays the range of the farthest target among a group of targets measured.

ID (Incline/Decline) Technology
Nikon's advanced ID Technology provides the horizontal distance to the target, even when ranging at various incline or decline shooting angles—up to an incredible +/- 89 degrees (nearly vertical up or down).

Features

 * Measurement Range: 8 - 1000 yds
 * Increment Reading: .1 yds
 * Magnification: 6 x
 * Units of measurement: meters/yards
 * Eye Relief: 18 mm
 * Power Source: 1 CR2 Lithium Battery
 * Size(Length x Width x Height), in: 3.9x1.9x3.0
 * Weight w/o Batteries: 7.1 oz
 * Objective Di
